technology.short_description: Thorgrim brooks no fools, Dawi or otherwise. He is stern - even for a High King - and his authority is absolute.

effects.description: High King Decrees: +1
Construction time: -1 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings

technology.short_description: Dwarfs excel at shieldwalls. Over the years, the Guilds, at the Clans' request, have experimented with interlocking shield designs.

effects.description: Ability: "Shieldwall" for Shielded Warrior and Longbeard units

attributes.bullet_text: This unit cannot run and will only move at walking pace.

technology.short_description: These courageous warriors have fought and survived countless underground battles.

effects.description: Attribute: Charge Reflection for Great Weapon Infantry units

related_attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit causes additional damage when attacking charging enemies.

technology.short_description: Dwarfs like to drink, sing and tell tall-tales. However, some stories concerning veterans may actually be true.

effects.description: Ability: "Shieldwall of Gromril" for Ironbreakers (Rank 7 and above)

attributes.bullet_text: Clad in heavy plates designed specifically to protect against projectiles, this unit is capable of deflecting even direct cannon fire!
This unit cannot run and will only move at walking pace.
Clad in heavy plates designed specifically to protect against projectiles, this unit is capable of deflecting even direct cannon fire!
This unit cannot run and will only move at walking pace.

effects.description: Attribute: Encourage for Hammerer units (Rank 7 and above)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +5% for Hammer Infantry and Ironbreaker units

technology.short_description: A Slayer's wrath is not something enemies wish to see - they do not fear death, they crave it!

effects.description: Charge bonus: +10 for all Slayer units
Ability: "Whirlwind of Death Upgraded" for Doomseeker units (Rank 7 and above)

technology.short_description: In the lower deeps of any Hold are the sealed vaults. They are cool and dark, perfect for storing foodstuffs and other vital supplies.

effects.description: Construction time: -1 for Defence buildings

technology.short_description: Dwarf treasuries are often as deep as their vaultsâ€¦ which can be very deep!

effects.description: Income from Province Capital/Settlement buildings: +10%

technology.short_description: It is in the Guild halls where the ruling councils meet to discuss policy, tariffs, and to further their goals.

effects.description: Construction time: -1 for Military Recruitment buildings
Construction time: -1 for Military Support buildings

technology.short_description: Every Dwarf must make unbreakable oaths to his King. Only the most scraggiest of beard-wearers would think to break them.

effects.description: High King Decrees: +1
Global recruitment capacity: +1

Local recruitment capacity: +1
	(all provinces)

technology.short_description: In the deeps, the Ironbreakers are always on call, ready to defend the Hold from threats below.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Shielded Warrior and Longbeard units
Armour: +5 for Shielded Warrior and Longbeard units

technology.short_description: Dwarfs are not ones for innovation, but refining a process to perfection is a totally different matter!

effects.description: Ammunition: +100% Miners units

technology.short_description: If you want a job doing properly, albeit with some moaning, then get a Longbeard.

effects.description: Armour-piercing weapon damage: +5% for Great Weapon Infantry units
Charge bonus: +10 for Great Weapon Infantry units

technology.short_description: Dwarfs are expert armourers, both as creators and wearers. They have the skills to fashion it and the sturdy frames to bear its weight.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Hammerer and Ironbreaker units
Missile resistance: 15% for Hammerer and Ironbreaker units

technology.short_description: To read aloud from the Hold's Book of Grudges is to enrage all Dawi and bring them to battle.

effects.description: Shared cooldown: -10% for all Rune Magic

technology.short_description: When the Runepriests enter a Karak, they will stop at the Shrine of Grimnir, granting his favour to any who wish it.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for all Slayer units
Melee defence: +4 for all Slayer units

technology.short_description: The putting together of great Dwarfen heads always results in the optimal solution, even when facing the foulest, most abominable problem.

effects.description:
Defensive supplies: +500
	(factionwide)
Casualty replenishment rate: +5%
Attrition: -20% when under siege

technology.short_description: To grow the Everlasting Realm, the Guilds send subsidies to make settlements old and new sustainable.

effects.description: Construction cost: -5% for Province Capital/Settlement buildings

technology.short_description: The 'Grims' - small Dwarf tokens attached to their products - are a sign of quality even the manlings understand.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +1

technology.short_description: Thanes speak with the word of their King, and so the Guilds' rarely question such direct commands.

effects.description: Hero capacity: +1 for Thanes
Hero recruit rank: +3 for Thanes
Control: +2

technology.short_description: As Dwarf Guilds wield such power, it makes sense that the Clans keep an eye on them, ensuring competence and honesty.

effects.description: High King's Tribute commandment: additional 5% income
Masters of Steel and Stone commandment: additional -5% to recruitment cost

technology.short_description: Dwarf Runepriests are rare, but when they visit the Holds they inscribe the Protection of Valaya upon home and hearth.

effects.description: Hero capacity: +1 for Runesmiths
Hero recruit rank: +3 for Runesmiths

Ambush defence chance: +25%
	(all armies)

technology.short_description: All members of the Clan will answer its call, swearing oaths against those who have wronged them.

effects.description: Melee defence: +4 for Shielded Warrior and Longbeard units

technology.short_description: Every Dwarf practices a trade, but as war is common each Clan readily forms into one or more regiments.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Miner units
Melee defence: +4 for Miner units

technology.short_description: It is the Dawi's solemn obligation to protect the deeps of their Karaks.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Great Weapon Infantry units

technology.short_description: As both honour and sworn duty, the Hammerers are the royal guard, accompanying Lord or King into battle.

effects.description: Physical resistance: 5% for Hammerer and Ironbreaker units

technology.short_description: Dwarfen runes empower weapons already forged by the finest smiths, making a potent axe a truly deadly item.

effects.description: Cooldown: -10% to Rune abilities

technology.short_description: Those that have taken the Slayer Oath must seek their doom in combat to appease an earlier shame.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -25% for all Slayer units
Speed: +15% for all Slayer units

technology.short_description: Along with the Engineers, the Construction Guilds are some of the most powerful, for every Dwarf needs a home.

effects.description: Removes and prevents all 'Blocked Tunnels' in all Deeps locations
Construction time: -1 for all buildings (minimum of 1 turn)
Construction cost: -4% for all buildings

technology.short_description: When the Thanes call to gather the throngs, it is the Clans that answer, for they have bonds stronger than Gromril.

effects.description: Age of Reckoning Grudge Settler army size: +5

technology.short_description: A powerful, authoritative voice in any Hold, the Guilds dominate Dwarfen civil life, controlling trade, finances and labour.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +10 with Dwarfs

technology.short_description: Dwarf grinding stones are always perfectly round and decorated with geometric scrawls and runes, usually of Valaya's making.

effects.description: Growth: +10

technology.short_description: Dwarfholds tend to trade with each other via the Underway, which keeps prying eyes out of Dawi business.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +5%
Cooldown after Underway Network travel: -2 turns

technology.short_description: The Runepriests bestow Grungni's Blessing on Guild works, ensuring profitable ventures for all.

effects.description: Income from all buildings: +4%

technology.short_description: The grander the Throne Chamber, the more envious and intimidated the King's audience or 'guests' will be.

effects.description: Population surplus: 2 for newly-captured settlements
High King Decrees: +1

technology.short_description: A rolling Dwarfen song contains many verses and a constant rhythm, used to keep in step and up to pace.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +5%
Speed: +5% for Infantry units

technology.short_description: Once word is given that it's war, the message quickly passes down the ranks from Kings to Lords to Thanes.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -5% for Infantry units

technology.short_description: As with all Dawi Guilds, the Dwarf warrior tradition also follows the path of apprentice, journeyman and master.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -15% for Grudge Settler units
Unit experience gain: +20% for Infantry units
+2 Grudge Settler unit capacity per army

technology.short_description: The tombs of the Ancestors are shrines, for Dwarfs revere age, experience and unbroken blood lines.

effects.description:
Character experience gain: +10%
	(all characters)

Wound recovery time: -1 turns
	(all characters)

technology.short_description: By standing atop an Oath Stone, followers' resolve is increased, ensuring a champion's foes can find him in the scrum.

effects.description: Upkeep: -4% for all units

technology.short_description: Dwarfen Emissaries use their forbearance of other races to play the game of diplomacy as well as any Elf, lacing palms with oathgold as needed.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +50 with Empire, Kislev, Cathay and Bretonnia
Allegiance points gained: +20%

technology.short_description: No Longbeard would ever consider breaking an oath. If he promised to come, there he will be.

effects.description: +3 Grudge Settler unit capacity per army

technology.short_description: Thanks to the Guilds, Dwarfs excel at getting resources out of the ground - no matter how deep!

effects.description: Income from Iron Mines, Gold Mines and Stone Quarries: +10%

technology.short_description: The Royal Clan is entitled to its tithe. The Reckoners guarantee that the Guilds pay up.

effects.description: Oathgold from buildings: +15%

technology.short_description: When a Dawi is in need of decent hammer or axe, the tool market is the place to find it.

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for resource-producing buildings

technology.short_description: Not just any beardling can operate war machines, so the Engineers' Guild ensures only approved crew operate its instruments.

effects.description: Research rate: +10
Hero capacity: +1 for Master Engineers
Hero recruit rank: +3 for Master Engineers

technology.short_description: Karaz Ankor states that, while all Dwarfholds swear fealty to the High King, they are ruled independently.

effects.description: Venerate the Ancestors commandment: additional -1 corruption reduction
Empower the Guilds commandment: additional 10 growth

technology.short_description: Some tombs lay closed, forever sealed with stones covered in ancient runes that glow when evil lurks nearby.

effects.description: Hero capacity: +1 for Dragon Slayers
Hero recruit rank: +3 for Dragon Slayers

Corruption: -3
	(all provinces)

technology.short_description: The Clans constantly order in black powder and make demands for better quality, deadlier batches as well.

effects.description: Range: +10% for Thunderer and Slayer Pirate units
Missile strength: +5% for Thunderers and Slayer Pirate units

technology.short_description: Skilled in fighting at the vanguard of the Dwarfsâ€™ main force, Rangers fulfil a dangerous role fraught with risk and unimaginable peril.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Quarrellers and Rangers units
Speed: +10% for Quarreller and Ranger units

technology.short_description: Regulating pressure is an important aspect of many Dwarf devices. New, self-releasing valves heighten such performance.

effects.description: Ammunition: +10% for Irondrake units
Range: +10% for Irondrakes units

technology.short_description: Again the Dwarfen forges speak, casting a new type of ammunition - large shells filled with cinderblast.

effects.description: Ammunition: +20% for Artillery units
Missile strength: +5% for Artillery units

technology.short_description: A Dawi Lord's retainers are his loyal servants and bodyguards, be they shield or throne bearers.

effects.description: Leadership: +5 for Lords and embedded Heroes
Armour: +10 for Lords and embedded Heroes
Melee defence: +5 for Lords and embedded Heroes

technology.short_description: Combining runes of lifting with heavy armour plate increases protection without compromising a 'copter's ability to fly!

effects.description: Armour: +15 for Gyrocopters, Gyrobombers and Thunderbarge units
Missile resistance: 10% for Gyrocopters, Gyrobombers and Thunderbarge units

technology.short_description: Dwarfen picks of Gromril are rare, but only needed when mining for star-iron ore, as like finds like.

effects.description: Income from Gem Cutters and Obsidian Quarries: +5%

technology.short_description: The august Toolmakers are a young but powerful Guild, as all Dawi that practise a craft need tools.

effects.description: Income from Industry building chain: +5%

technology.short_description: Using tar and hide, the Dwarfs can effectively waterproof certain supplies that are otherwise prone to spoilage.

effects.description: Income from trade tariffs: +5%
Tradable resources produced: +10%

technology.short_description: Nepotism is not a dirty word in Dwarf society. The Guilds encourage it, for family honour is prized.

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide
Lord recruit rank: +3

technology.short_description: Deadeyes can pick off a grobi's nose at a hundred paces. For really good ones, it's twice that range.

effects.description: Range: +10% for Thunderer and Slayer Pirate units

technology.short_description: Puresteel crossbows are precision-crafted instruments, able to accurately deliver death from afar.

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +10% for Quarrellers and Rangers units

technology.short_description: Automated assembly lines increase production but also safeguard quality, according to the Guilds anyway.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +1 for Irondrakes units

technology.short_description: At a Clan's request, Field Engineers are sent by their Guild, attached to artillery to ensure increased rates of fire.

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +10% for Artillery units

technology.short_description: Dwarfen weaponsmithing is the finest in the world - a gift from the Guilds to their fellow Clans-kin.

effects.description: Missile strength: +8% for Lords and embedded Heroes
Melee attack: +5 for Lords and embedded Heroes
Weapon strength: +8% for Lords and embedded Heroes

technology.short_description: Artillery Engineers soon found that the benefit of keeping certain parts modular allowed for improvements in the manufacturing process.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +5% for Gyrocopters, Gyrobombers and Thunderbarge units
Upkeep: -5% for Gyrocopters, Gyrobombers and Thunderbarge units

technology.short_description: Dwarfs are industrious. When the Guilds call for construction, their members gather and work their beards off!

effects.description: Construction time: -1 for Infrastructure buildings

technology.short_description: The so-called "Iron Price" is not the wage, but the cost of having troops away from normal duty.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Thunderer and Slayer Pirate units

technology.short_description: The alchemical brew used to fuel the flaming drakeguns can be made more potent, if a tad more unstableâ€¦

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +10% for Irondrake units

technology.short_description: Dwarfs excel at artillery placement and creating bulwarks and trenches for their defence.

effects.description: Attribute: Immune to Flanking for Artillery units

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit takes no penalties when flanked.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 15% for Artillery units

technology.short_description: Innovations in engine mechanics means faster 'copters. Even now, many aircraft are being retro-fitted with improved engines.

effects.description: Speed: +10% for Gyrocopters, Gyrobombers and Thunderbarge units
Attribute: Vanguard Deployment for Gyrocopters, Gyrobombers and Thunderbarge units

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
